Posts.Content: anne39 wrote: I have just been put on Tamoxifen, after all of the aromatase drugs stopped working, and will add Afinitor after my onc. appeals the combination with Medicare who has denied it at this point.  A side effect of the Afinitor seems to be low counts ; however, no one else has mentioned any trouble with low counts while on Afinitor in any of the postings.  I am due to go to France in April and am getting worried about picking up an infection while traveling and it is recommended that one head for the ER when temp. rises to 100.5.  I wonder if the low counts really is a problem for anyone or just one of those many many side effects that are listed without little consequence. Have mets in spine, pelvis, and a 5 cm spot in the liver.  I relapsed in the lungs  after 17 years in 2010, but have just had mets in the bones and liver for one year.  My lungs are fine after radiation in 2010.  The liver spot is troubling to me.  I would appreciate any info on Afinitor esecially the combination with Tamoxifen.  I am 75 years old, have perfect lab reports, and would never know that there was anything wrong with me if I did not see the scans every 3months. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and Afinitor Together anne39 sandybiest

Posts.Content: anne39 wrote: I have been on Taxol for 4 months and have had multiple urinary tract infections as well as what are probably noninfectious irritations. Has anyone else had a similar experience with Taxol or any other chemo? How do youu deal with the noninfectious ones which are not treated with antibiotics? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: urinary tract irritation.. anne39 skylotus

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2015 04:59AM - edited Aug 31, 2015 05:08AM by anne39 Diagnosed in 1993, relapsed to Stage IV in 2010 and still here. Was treated with radiation to the lungs, hormone therapy until 2014 then Xeloda (a terrible experience); took a break to recover and then started Taxol in April 2015. I have mets in liver, lungs and bones.
